page.title: 15HERRING INDUSTRY
page.content: In 1910 there was a boom in the herring industry just before the First World War. The boats used were called Zulus, Scaffies and Fyfies-all types of drifters which had nets which hung down like curtains into the water.The fishing boats were first powered by steam.The boats went out, caught the fish and then landed their catch because the fish didn't keep long.Gutters worked in the market from 6 in the morning till late at night, earning poor wages.After the fish were gutted, they were rinsed and soaked with salt. A cooper came and checked the barrels then the lids were put on and stamped.After all the barrels were packed they were exported all over the world but mainly to Russia.
